pr_title: [Issue 2608] Add ability to periodically persist hot states

timeline.message: Add column for hot states, add CRUD methods for hot states
Update RocksDbDatabase to persist hot states
Persist hot states at epoch boundaries
Add API for pulling hot state by root from the database
Look up recent epoch boundary states before reprocessing full chain
Only attempt to pull the latest epoch boundary state
Move hot state persistence config to StoreOptions
Wire hot state persistent option through to CLI
Rework StateProvider to consolidate queries to ChainStorage

timeline.bodyText:
I'm still in two minds but I wonder if we should just make StoreOptions an interface that TekuConfiguration implements, then we don't have to rebuild a different config object, but still narrow down what gets passed in.  It already does it for MetricsConfig which I think was mostly driven by module dependencies but it seems to work (and eventually TekuConfiguration could just hold multiple separate objects so you getMetricsConfig out of it instead of using it directly.
Happy to go either way with this at the moment though.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: I don't think that works because it would create circular dependencies:  storage depends on util, so util can't depend on storage.
replies.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: Ugh.  Yeah we'd probably have to define StoreConfig in util.  Not worth the fight now I don't think.
replies.author: ajsutton
